metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16228 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: Dulwich before 0.18.5, when an SSH subprocess is used, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via an ssh URL with an initial dash character in the hostname, a related issue to CVE-2017-9800, CVE-2017-12836, CVE-2017-12976, CVE-2017-1000116, and CVE-2017-1000117.

criterions.comment: dulwich: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
